DataElement.preferredName: Intravenous Gadolinium Preload Administration Prior To Injection And Magnetic Resonance Imaging Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator to address the IV administration of an additional aliquot of gadolinium before the regular injection and MR imaging.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intravenous Gadolinium Drug Preload Administration Prior To Injection And Magnetic Resonance Imaging
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Administration of a drug within or into a vein or veins. Introduction of the drug directly into venous circulation results in 100% bioavailability due to an absence of the absorption phase, provides a precise and continuous mode of drug therapy, especially for drugs with a narrow therapeutic index._An element with atomic symbol Gd, atomic number 64, and atomic weight 157.25._The administration of an additional aliquot of an agent ahead of a standard dose, with the intent of raising the concentration of the agent in the compartment to which it is administered._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._Earlier in time or order._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._Use of a syringe and needle to push fluids or drugs into the body; often called a "shot."_An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Intravenous Route of Administration Gadolinium Drug Preload
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Administration within or into a vein or veins.:An element with atomic symbol Gd, atomic number 64, and atomic weight 157.25.:The administration of an additional aliquot of an agent ahead of a standard dose, with the intent of raising the concentration of the agent in the compartment to which it is administered.

Concepts.definition: Administration of a drug within or into a vein or veins. Introduction of the drug directly into venous circulation results in 100% bioavailability due to an absence of the absorption phase, provides a precise and continuous mode of drug therapy, especially for drugs with a narrow therapeutic index.
An element with atomic symbol Gd, atomic number 64, and atomic weight 157.25.
The administration of an additional aliquot of an agent ahead of a standard dose, with the intent of raising the concentration of the agent in the compartment to which it is administered.

Property.preferredName: Administration Prior To Injection Route of Administration And Magnetic Resonance Imaging
Property.preferredDefinition: The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:Earlier in time or order.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:Use of a syringe and needle to push fluids or drugs into the body; often called a "shot.":An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Concepts.definition: The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
Administration of a drug into a location within the body; this can be achieved either through an established access or via a needle.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk
